vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἅρπαξ, ᾰγος, ὁ, ἡ,
(ἁρπάζω) robbing, rapacious, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: also with substantive neuter, ἅρπαγι χείλει[Refs]: superlative ἁρπαγίστατος[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II mostly as substantive,
__II.1 ἅρπαξ, ἡ, rapine, [Refs 8th c.BC+]
__II.2 ἅρπαξ, ὁ, robber, peculator, τῶν δημοσίων[Refs 5th c.BC+]; πάντες εἰσὶν ἅρπαγες (i.e. οἱ Ὠρώπιοι) [Refs]
__II.3 species of wolf, [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__II.4 grappling-iron, used in sea-fights, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; flesh-hook, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: swindling, robbing, implying violence in the process; (destructively) ferocious, ravenous; as a noun, a (violent) robber or swindler
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
swindling, robbing, implying violence in the process; (destructively) ferocious, ravenous; as a noun, a (violent) robber or swindler
primarily raveneous, ravening, ferocious as a wild beast, Mt. 7:15; metaphorically rapacious, given to extortion and robbery, an extortioner, swindler, robber Lk. 18:11; 1Cor. 5:10, 11; 6:10*
